fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the *Time Tracking Report* the following fields are present:
* Issue Key
* Summary
* Original Estimate
* Est. Time Remaining
* Time Spent	
* Accuracy

The customer would like to add the *Priority* filed in the report. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to add more fields in the Time Tracking Report 
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Add possibility to add more fields in the Time Tracking Report

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When users create issue using the "+ Create Issue" that is in the Agile Board, then change to another Epic and use the "+ Create Issue" button again, the button will not work. Nothing happens when you click it.
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Open the "Backlog" view of a project.
 # Open up the "Epics" side panel.
 # Select an epic to filter by that epic.
 # Use the "+ Create issue" link to add one or more issues.
 # Select a different epic.
 # Try clicking "+ Create Issue" again.
 # If it still works, repeat step 4 to 6 again.
 # Repeat until it breaks.

h2. Expected Result

The "+ Create Issue" button should work and allow users to create issue.
h2. Current Result

The "+ Create Issue" button will randomly have no response when you click on it.
h2. Workaround

Use the "Create" button on the top menu bar instead.
fields.summary: "+ Create issue" link in Backlog does not work after switching to different epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring the board's saved filter, the suggestions will include the restricted filter as well. 

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.621.5
JIRA Agile v1000.216.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as user A 
# Create a filter and ensure it is a private filter (e.g: Filter ABC)
# Login as user B
# Go to any board and click on _Board Setting_ 
# Search for Filter ABC in Saved Filter field
# Click on it and the message below will be displayed on the UI:
#* !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Even though the error message is clear, the filter is not a public filter so it should not be in the suggestion list at the first place 

h3. Actual Results
The private or restricted filter is in the suggestion list when searching from board filter setting
fields.summary: Restricted filter is suggested when searching in Board filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When setting the Epic Link of an issue during a transition i.e., Edit screen, the Epic Link is not saved and subsequently does not show up on the issue view screen. If you set this manually using the Edit issue screen after the fact, the Epic Link shows up as expected

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.319.1
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic or use an existing Epic
# Ensure one of your transitions has a screen assigned to it that includes the Epic Link field
# Create a new issue but do not link the Epic
# Once the ticket is created transition the ticket through the screen transition
# Set the Epic Link

* This can happen during the create transition for an issue assuming that the Epic Link is a field in that screen. Tested and verified.

h3. Expected Results
The Epic Link should display in the ticket information on the Issue view screen

h3. Actual Results
The Epic Link does not display in the ticket information on the Issue view screen
 
h3.Workaround
Clicking the Edit button after the ticket is created and setting the Epic Link will save properly
fields.summary: When setting the Epic Link during a workflow transition screen, the Epic Link is not saved

fields.description: When trying to view a shared dashboard, users are receiving an Unexpected Error.  I can view the dashboard and have tried copying it so that I can re-share and I receive a 500 error.  Users unexpected error screenshot is attached
fields.summary: Unexpected Error received when trying to view a shared dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The attachment dropdown menu is not shown (actually it seems to be shown behind the comment text area) when selecting a card from a board and choosing *Add comment and flag*


\\
h3. Environment
- JIRA Software Cloud version 1000.110.0
- It was working fine in the previous releases


\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any board and select any ticket
# Add attachments (Images/Files) to the ticket
# Go to 'Add flag and comment' window of the same ticket:  
!add-flag-and-comment.png|thumbnail!
# Click on Attachments link 
!attachment-dropdown-not-shown.png|thumbnail!


\\
h3. Expected Results
Images/Files has to be displayed


\\
h3. Actual Results
Attached Images/Files list is not displaying
 !attachment-dropdown-not-shown.png|thumbnail! 

\\
h3.Workaround
Not available at the moment
fields.summary: Attachment dropdown menu not showing in "Add comment and flag" window in JIRA Software Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Kanban board overlaps sidebar when browser's width are less than 800 px. 
* Escalating the feature request [FEEDBACK-68939|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-68939] as this doesn't seem to be expected

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to kanban board
2. Minimize left popout menu of Jira (one that has project, backlog, kanban board, releases etc.)
3. Resize chrome to width < 800
4. Pop out left menu

h3. Expected Result
Kanban board should not overlap sidebar

h3. Actual Result
Here, kanban board is pop-up in front of Side bar menu, leaving me unable to click menu objects, including the ability to close the menu. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Maximizing window to fix this issue.
fields.summary: Frontend bug: kanban board overlaps left popout menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the board uses a filter where JIRA is not able to define what projects are related to the board, and the user has *Manage Sprints*, *Browse Projects* and *Schedule Issues* permission on all projects of the instance, JIRA still does not allow the user to manage sprints (create, complete).

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.253.3
JIRA Agile v1000.20.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a filter that will relate more than one project
# The following message will appear on the board configuration: *The projects in this board cannot be listed because of the complexity of the board filter*
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-19 at 2.53.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 

# Create a new user without admin permission on the instance
# Add permissions on all projects to *Manage Sprints*, *Browse Projects* and *Schedule Issues*.
# Try to create, complete or do any managing operation on the related sprint/board

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to manage sprints with only those 3 permissions
h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to manage sprints and the following message is displayed:  
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-19 at 2.51.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There are 2 workarounds available:

# Add administrator permission on the Cloud instance
# Restrict the filter's project to 1 project
fields.summary: Users are not able manage sprints

fields.description:
In OnDemand 146, after clicking the "Use Agile By Default" menu entry in the OnDemand drop-down user menu, the original layout of the user menu itself somehow got "corrupted", and clicking the corrupted user menu brings about another error screen. Please see attached screen-shots for details.

This happens with both a clean-installed and an upgraded (from 144) OnDemand instance.

(Edit: actually it happens with an older version 5.9.5 as well. Just didn't see it earlier. So it's not a new issue brought by 5.9.7-rc1)
fields.summary: "Use Agile By Default" corrupts OnDemand user menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Time Tracking is set to Display In hours the estimates values are displayed in Pretty
EXE: 
- 25.5 hours is displayed as 3d 1h 30m
- 15 min displays as 15m rather than .25h

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-05-006
* JIRA Agile v7.1.14-D20160120T021005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Agile Board
# Configure time Tracking to use HOURS as described in:
## https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/configuring-time-tracking-735940583.html
{quote}
The number of working hours per day is 8.
The number of working days per week is 5.
Time estimates will be displayed in the following format: hours (e.g. 36.5h)
The current default unit for time tracking is hour.
Copying of comments to work description is currently enabled.
{quote}
# Create Issue with an original estimate of 25.5 hours
# Add to Sprint

h3. Expected Results
Agile Board time tracking time tracking estimates will display 25.5h

h3. Actual Results
Time Tracking Displays 3d 1h 30m
!Screen Shot 2016-01-28 at 10.04.43 AM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2016-01-28 at 10.08.23 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
There is no Workaround At this time
fields.summary: Time Tracking Set For Hours Displays in Pretty

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After setting up the integration between JIRA and GitHub, the Development Tool Panel is not showing though the users have View Development Tools permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Register JIRA application in GitHub as guided in https://help.github.com/articles/integrating-jira-with-your-projects/
# In JIRA instance (eg: example.atlassian.net), Administration > Applications
# DVCS Accounts > Link GitHub account
# Under *Host*, choose GitHub from the dropdown menu.
# Under *Team or User Account*, type the name of your GitHub account.
# Key in the *Client ID* and *Client Secret*.
# *Add*.
# Review the permissions that you are granting to your GitHub and click *Authorize application*.
# Go to any issue to check the whether the Development Tool Panel is showing.

h3. Expected Results
Development Tools Panel will be shown in View Issue Screen after integrated successfully.
!Screenshot2.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Development Tools Panel is not showing after the integration.
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* Development Tools Panel is working fine for Bitbucket integration.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Development Tools Panel Is Not Showing When Integrate With GitHub

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

After upgrading to JIRA 6.3-OD1, the {{DvcsScheduler}} job is not running.

This stops the hourly scheduled synchronization.

Commits and Pull requests sync could still be triggered by Bitbucket/GitHub webhook. However, for systems which upgrade from an earlier version to 1.4.15 and later and have not changed the DVCS accounts, pull requests webhooks are not created, thus pull requests would not be synchronized.

This issue does not affect JIRA 6.2.1 BTF.

h4. Workaround
As a workaround, manually clicking on the sync icon on the DVCS Accounts page would run the synchronization, though each click does it once only.
fields.summary: DvcsScheduler job is not running, stops the scheduled synchronisation

fields.description:
At the moment a Webhook will never fire if an issue is added to an Epic. Either via the Agile board, or by editing the issue from the screen itself.
Even with all event types checked, (ie. issue updated etc), the webhook will not fire.

*Steps to reproduce*
# set up a webhook that triggers from everything.
# Create an Agile Scrum board with an epic and some issues.
# From the Scrum Board, drag the issue onto your epic.
# Check the target of the webhook, no update will be received
** Try editing a field of an issue, you'll see the the webhook is fired properly for other edits.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not fire from adding issue to Epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Kanban board with _backlog_, navigating to the Kanban board displays the title from the backlog instead of the board title. For example my project kanban board is named "NAME". I'm currently navigated to the backlog. When I click the menu option to navigate to the "NAME" kanban board, the title of the board will be *Backlog* instead of "NAME".

 
h3. Workaround

No Workaround.
fields.summary: Wrong kanban board title appears when navigating from backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to [Setting column constraints|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-columns-764477997.html#Configuringcolumns-columnconstraintsSettingcolumnconstraints]:
{quote}
Column constraints apply to the total number of issues in a column, regardless of whether issues are hidden by a Quick Filter.
{quote}

However, when a _Quick Filter_ is selected, the number issues shown in a column becomes lesser and if the number of issues doesn't meet the minimum number, it will show _Yellow color_

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a board and 5 issues in it
# Go to the board's column configuration and set column constraint for Min is 2 and Max is 4 for the left most column
# Make sure 5 of the issues are in the left most column
# Assign 1 of the issues to the current user
# Go back to the board and click _Only My Issues_ quick filter

h3. Actual Result

- When there's no any quick filter selected, the board shows Red color. (/)
- When _Only My Issues_ quick filter is selected, the columns changed to _Yellow color_. (x)

h3. Expected Result

- When there's no any quick filter selected, the board shows Red color. 
- When _Only My Issues_ quick filter is selected, the columns should stay the same.
fields.summary: Board doesn't respect the total number of issues in column when Quick filter is selected

fields.description:
Original summary -- New card layout excessively wraps words

h3. Problem Definition
The new card layout easily wraps word (much more than before) due to the font size, depending on how much columns you use on the kanban board. (print below). !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the card layout display a more words while in normal zoom

h3. Workaround.
Zoom-out the page or have less columns on the board.
fields.summary: Card layout not supporting narrow widths

fields.description:
When viewing reports in GreenHopper (Sprint Report for example), users have the ability to select the relevant Sprint from the sprint dropdown:
!Sp.png!
However, when the board has several completed sprints, the most recent ones can't be selected from the list. In the screenshot below there's a total of 29 sprints, but Sprints 26, 27 and 28 can't be seen:
!Sp2.png!
The available workaround would be to zoom out the screen to be able to see the entire list, or use a bigger monitor.
fields.summary: Users can't view reports in boards with large number of completed sprints

fields.description:
There is not way to keep track of sub-tasks when working with Kanban Backlog feature.

For example, lets say you have a task with multiple sub-tasks on the backlog. If you drag the task to "Pending" status, the task will be shown on the board, whereas the sub-tasks will remain on "backlog" status until you explicitly move them to "Pending" or whatever other status as well. 

Steps to Reproduce

# Enabled Kanban Backlog LABS feature (the To Do column on the board is replaced Backlog right away)
# Navigate to Backlog tab.
# Drag a task which has sub-tasks in it from the backlog to Pending. On the board, only the task is shown, whereas the sub-tasks remain on backlog status.
#* By default Backlog doesn't show sub-tasks.

Workaround

The workaround in this case is not to enable the feature and add a To Do column to the board as the backlog. That way it'll be able to see all the tasks and sub-tasks as well.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks are not shown on Kanban board with Kanban Backlog feature enabled.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an issue in JIRA
# Create and start a sprint with the issue included in the sprint
# Drag the issue into Done column and complete the sprint
# Go to the issue and check if *Completed Sprint* with the sprint name as its value is present
# If it present, click on *Update*
# Nothing will happen and the error above is thrown

h3. Workaround
Remove *Sprint* field from _Edit Issue_ screen and issue update should be working again.
fields.summary: Users can't update JIRA issue if Sprint field present only with a value for Completed Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

View Dashboard as Wallboard shows blank page after closing and reopening browser.

h3. Environment

Chrome version 53.0.2785.143

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Login to the instance and make sure to tick to _Keep me logged in_
# Have a dashboard and _Agile Wallboard gadget_ in it
# View as Wallboard and copy the link
# Close the browser and reopen it
# Paste the {{View as Wallboard}} link and open it

h3. Actual Results

The page shows a blank page.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

_Agile Wallboard gadget_ shown in Wallboard view.
fields.summary: View Dashboard as Wallboard shows blank page after closing and reopening browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't comply with the quick filter that is chosen in the settings and is returning incorrect results. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version {{1000.253.3}}
* JIRA Agile version {{1000.20.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and assign some issues to yourself.
# Cretea dashboard.
# Add the gadget _Agile Wallboard Gadget_.
# Edit the settings to reflect the board created above and choose the quick filter "Only Me".

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should only show issues on the board which is assigned to yourself. 

h3. Actual Results
Gadget displays all issues on the board.

Error in network console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: this._getScriptsForResources(...).done is not a function
POST https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest 400 (Bad Request)
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'x-seraph-trusted-app-status' of undefined
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Also occuring for the quick filter: {{assignee = currentUser()}}

h3.Workaround
View the quick filter directly on the respective board.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget's quick filter returning incorrect results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

# Workload pie chart is not working, it shows an error 
{code:java}
"The resource /rest/chartplugin/1.0/workloadpie/generate, cannot be found"{code}
It's not possible to create new Worklog Pie charts as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Dashboard with Workload Pie Chart

h3. Expected Results

The Workload pie chart should be shown

h3. Actual Results

It throws an error in the UI: "The resource /rest/chartplugin/1.0/workloadpie/generate, cannot be found."


h3. Workaround

* Navigate to Project view -> *Reports*
* Use "Switch Report" drop down list and switch to "All Reports" view if it's not loaded by the default
* *Workload Pie Chart Report* is available at the bottom of the page, in *Others* section
* Other reports are available as the workaround to broken Agile gadgets
fields.summary: Workload pie chart is not working

Currently, there is no way to move tickets between sprints and the backlog without affecting the rank value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to move tickets between the backlog and sprints while maintaining the rank value.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

If there is 2 or more post function for {{Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step}}, it will result on the reports for JIRA Software (Burndown, Sprint Report, Cumulative flow) unable to determine the status of the issue.

h2. Steps to replicate

# Create a new software project with simplified workflow
# Navigate to the active workflow
# On the done transition, add {{Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step}} post function
# Publish the altered workflow

h2. Expected Result

It will still works as the status is set to Done, it should be considered issue completed on the affected reports.

h2. Actual Result

Nothing is shown on the report, as if the action never occurs

h2. Workaround

If you have previously saved a copy of the workflow before adding the post function, please revert to the older workflow.
If you have not saved any copy, you will need to download the XML workflow representation, removed the post function from there and update the database. 

Cloud customer, please contact support to assist on fixing this issue.

h2. Additional Information

Discovered on Cloud version {{1000.482.1}}
fields.summary: Software Reports Rendered incorrectly if there are 2 post functions to Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step

fields.description:
The recent upgrade to JIRA OnDemand of 'Enhanced visibility into the development status for an issue' as mentioned in [What's New|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/What's+New] can cause 'Commits' tab to still be visible to some users.

The expected behaviour is only the 'Development' panel to be shown.

*Workaround:*
Please raise a ticket at support.atlassian.com, our support team can review the features enabled and update where necessary.
fields.summary: Commit tab in JIRA is visible to some users along with the 'Development' panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding versions using the versions panel in the project backlog view of an agile board, these versions do not translate to the versions section of the project admin. However, if you add a version within the version section of the project admin, those versions will appear in the versions panel of the project backlog.

h3. Environment
Cloud 
JIRA v1000.98.4 / JIRA Agile v1000.0.7-D20160618T073834


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to a project that has an agile board
# Click on the Backlog section
# Open the Versions tab
# Create a new version
# Browse the project admin section
# Click on the Versions link in the left hand menu

h3. Expected Results
The version you created in the versions panel of the project backlog should be displayed here

h3. Actual Results
The version you created in the versions panel of the project backlog is not displayed

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Subsequently

# Browse to a project that has an agile board
# Browse to the project admin section of the board
# Click on the Versions link in the left hand menu
# Create a new version
# Browse to the project backlog section of the board
# Open the Versions tab

h3.Workaround
Versions should be created within the project admin section to ensure they show up within the Versions panel of the project backlog
fields.summary: Versions created in project backlog versions panel do not display in versions section of project admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a commit that has already been pushed to Bitbucket is rebased and reworded to update the commit message with a different issue key, a new commit hash is generated. DVCS correctly associates this with the updated issue. However, the previous commit hash that is no longer displayed in Bitbucket still appears in the development panel in JIRA.

A hard synchronization of the repository does not remove it. Eventually, the commit will no longer appear in the development panel, but this takes an undetermined amount of time and it is not clear by what mechanism it is eventually removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make 2 commits in a branch in Bitbucket, specifying the same JIRA issue key for both in the commit message.
# Push these commits to Bitbucket
# Perform an interactive rebase of the first commit, rewording the commit message and specifying a different existing JIRA issue key.
# Force push these changes after the rebase.

h3. Expected Results
Development panel in the associated JIRA issue views displays updated commit details after rebase and force push.

h3. Actual Results
The rebased commit is still shown as associated with the JIRA issue it was initially tagged with in it's commit message. This commit hash is no longer visible in the repository in Bitbucket. Forcing a Full Re-synchronization of the repository removes the commit from the commit details panel, but displays a permissions warning. The commit count in the development panel remains inaccurate.

 !image-2016-07-11-18-03-17-452.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2016-07-11-18-03-55-955.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Attempting a {{git gc}} or a {{git gc --aggressive}} and then a force push does not resolve the issue.

h3.Workaround
Wait. Eventually, the commit will expire and will no longer be displayed.
fields.summary: Rebased Commits Remain on Development Panel

fields.description:
When a user has JIRA Agile enabled, sets their home as the Agile home (/secure/RapidStart.jspa) and unsubscribes from JIRA Agile, whenever they log in, they get a 'redirect loop'. 

This happens because the Agile home page is giving a redirect loop (as it's not available anymore) and it remains as the user's home. Whenever the user logs in, they see this error.

After navigating back to the System Dashboard, we can see that the user doesn't have a home set:
!home.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have JIRA Agile enabled
# Set your home as Agile home, by clicking profile (your avatar image) >> Agile (under 'MY JIRA HOME')
# Unsubscribe from Agile
# Log off
# Log in again

*Expected behavior*
* Home is automatically changed to System Dashboard (or some other accessible page)

*Actual behavior*
* After logging in the customer sees a redirect loop error that says:
{noformat}
This webpage has a redirect loop
ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
{noformat}

*Workaround 1*
# Log in and get the redirect error
# Change the URL, replace '/secure/RapidStart.jspa' to '/secure/Dashboard.jspa' and navigate to it
#* You'll access JIRA correctly now
# Click the profile icon (your avatar image on the top right)
# Select some other home page under 'MY JIRA HOME'
# You'll be redirected to this home page when logging in

*Workaround 2*
# Log in using the URL instance-name/secure/Dashboard.jspa
# Click on the 'cog' icon > add-ons
# Click on Manage add-ons and search for Agile
# Disable the Agile Plugins
# This will fix for all users.
fields.summary: After unsubscribing from JIRA Agile, user may get a redirect loop when logging, when redirected to Agile home ('RapidStart') page

fields.description:
DVCS link to the wrong repository when create a pull request from a private user account instead of team account.

For example:
If there are 2 Bitbucket account:
- *AtlassianTestTeam* (Team Account)
- *Atlassianprivate* (User private account)

The *AtlassianTestTeam* account is already associated to JIRA through DVCS, but when create a branch using the *Atlassianprivate* account It’ll make the JIRA associate the branch with the Team account instead of User Private account. The JIRA will link to:
{quote}https://bitbucket.org/AtlassianTestTeam/atlassian_test/branch/TEST-1-dvcs{quote}
Instead of 
{quote}https://bitbucket.org/Atlassianprivate/atlassian_test/branch/TEST-1-dvcs{quote}

The link will generate error 404 due to wrong link into JIRA.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create JIRA issue
# Create branch in private user account using *Create Branch* button in JIRA issue. (No link in JIRA to branch at this point)
# Create pull request from private user account into team 
# Branch link shows up in JIRA
# Branch link is 404 because it assumes team account not private user account
fields.summary: JIRA link to the wrong repository when the branch is from a pull request merging from a fork

When we have a board associated with a project, if we change the board's filter in such a way that the project can no longer be listed by the board, the board will remain linked to the project, the 'quick create issue' option will remain available but will give the following error:
!error.png|thumbnail!

{code}
No project selected.
{code}

{code}
The issue type selected is invalid.
{code}

The 'issue type' error is not always happening.

I couldn't find the versions in 'Affect Version/s' field. They are:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum project with a board (say, key is 'TS')

project = TS or labels in ('noissuehasthislabel') ORDER BY Rank ASC

h3. Summary

Epic burndown chart is not displaying information for tickets with time estimation matching board configuration without JIRA Software. This problem appears to occur specifically when the issue is added to the Epic during issue creation, as opposed to being added after the issue is already created.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.35.2
JIRA Agile v1000.0.4-D20160607T123719



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Agile board
# Configure the board estimation to be based on Original Time Estimate
# Create a new Epic within an Agile board
# Create a new issue within that Epic
# Give the new issue Original Time Estimate points and Time Remaining points
# Create a new sprint within the Agile board
# Add the new ticket to the sprint
# Start the sprint
# View the Epic burndown chart report


h3. Expected Results
Report should display ticket information for the one ticket you added to the Epic


h3. Actual Results
No issues are displayed
Instead the Epic burndown chart report displays a message stating you have no issues with estimations

h3. Workaround
When creating issues do not link the Epic to the ticket. Once the issue has been created, linking the Epic should result in issues being reported.

It should be noted that for any issues that had their Epic linked during creation, they will not show up. There is currently no work around to fix these issues.
fields.summary: Epic burndown chart report not displaying issues when linked during issue creation

fields.description:
When we access the PR API in Bitbucket or Github we only receive a string which is the username of the user and (for Bitbucket) a uuid, we don't get the email.

When we are trying to attach a user to a PR we only have this username string to work with so we then perform a lookup to see what emails are available for that username. We then filter through those emails either returning a single match or if there are multiple emails one that matches the username.

When there are multiple combinations of Author and Commiter values across changesets however this can confuse the user association.

In some rare cases we are getting the wrong user associated. In this situation you have changesets where the same 'Author Name' is associated with different emails or there are overlaps between different users for Author and Commiter. This goes through username / email filtering resulting in incorrect user association. A typical scenario that could cause this would be two commits structured like this:

||Hash||Author Name|| Author Email
|ABC|susan| susan@example.com
|XYZ|susan|someoneelse@example.com

Or alternatively
||Hash||Author Name|| Author Email || Commiter Name || Commiter Email
|ABC|susan| susan@example.com|someone else | someoneelse@example.com

To check for this data you can run 
{code:java}
git log --pretty=format:"%h%nAuthor: %an %ae%nCommiter: %cn %ce" HASH

{code}

Which will output the author and commiter from the git repository. If these are not the same or if the single 'author name' maps to multiple emails then this may lead to incorrect user association.
fields.summary: Commits with different emails for the same user name can break user association in Pull Requests

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create an epic.
# Create a issue in the epic. Make sure that you populate the epic field when you create the issue.
# Create a sprint. Put the newly created issue in the sprint and start the sprint.
# Move the issue to done and complete the sprint.
# Go to the Epic Burndown chart. 

Expected result:
The issue shows up on the Epic Burndown chart, and is also present in the 'Completed Issues' section.

Actual result:
The issue doesn't show up in the Epic Burndown.


*Notes on the fix:*
The fix will be not correct old issues that were created with an epic link. It will only affect new issues.
To correct previous Epic Burndown reports on a Cloud JIRA site please [contact Cloud support|https://support.atlassian.com]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Project linked from JIRA to bitbucket initiating a Merge in bitbucket fails to render the Merge request under development tools panel until a subsequent Pull trigger is initiated on the repo

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v1000.203.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Bitbucket to JIRA
# Create Branch from development tools panel >> Make commit's >> Create Pull Request >> Merge

h3. Expected Results
Development tools panel Shows:
1 pull request MERGED

h3. Actual Results
- 1 pull request OPEN
!Merged.png|thumbnail!
- The Pull request will stay open in the development tools panel until The Next Pull Request on the repo is triggered on another issue/branch.
-- exe: On second issue >> Create Branch from development tools panel >> Make commit's >> Create Pull Request << At this point origional issue shows Merged
- When the subsequent pull request is triggered the Timestamp of the merge reflects actual time of the merge not time processed
 
h3. Notes
This will also cause triggers to fail and deviate timestamp as the merge does not occur with the trigger:
- Pull request merged - Automatically transitions the issue when a related pull request is merged in a connected repository.
- Causes:
-- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14664

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Merge fails in development tools panel until additional activity is triggered on repo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflow triggers for *Pull request merged* fail because of delay in development tools

Caused By:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14663

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v1000.203.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Bitbucket to JIRA
# Add *Pull request merged* workflow trigger to issue transition as described [Configuring workflow triggers | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAcloud/Configuring+workflow+triggers]
# Create Branch from development tools panel >> Make commit's >> Create Pull Request >> Merge

h3. Expected Results
Workflow Transition trigger's as the Merge is initiated

h3. Actual Results
Due to the development tools panel bug [JSW-14663 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14663] the transition is never triggered unless an additional pull request is triggered on the repo which allows the development panel to refresh and register the mege, therefor the timestamp of the merge is deviated from the timestamp of the transition
- i.e. could sit for days in the incorrect status waiting for a follow up pull request that causes the development tools panel to refresh, 
- once the pull is initiated the merge is registered with timestamp on bitbucket, but Transition is set with timestamp the transition occurs in JIRA

h3.Workaround
Manually transition workflow steps that rely on merge triggers
fields.summary: Merge Workflow Trigger fails

fields.description: The scrumboard doesn't show estimated hours and remaining hours if the main-ticket has sub-tasks and the time tracking on the main ticket inclues sub-tasks. Please refer to the attachments.
fields.summary: The scrumboard doesn't show estimated hours and remaining hours

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A null pointer exception error is displayed when trying to move an issue after selecting another issue and clicking on the board's name under the Board menu.
h3. Environment
Cloud:
* JIRA v1000.305.0
* JIRA Agile v1000.37.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select an issue on any board so that the Agile Detail View is opened for it.
# Reload the board by choosing the board name from the "Boards" option in the top menu.
# Try to dragging any other issue (without selecting first) to another column => the error popups
Video reproducing: http://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cDjbbJiNOP
h3. Expected Results
The issue selected must be moved to the desired queue
h3. Actual Results
The error below is displayed:
 !2016-06-29 11_35_45-New notification.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Select the Issue before moving it
fields.summary: Error script on dragging issue in work mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking 'View Summary of Assigned Work' will load the first time, but subsequent attempts will fail. In addition hot keys become broken.

Environment:
* JIRA Software Cloud version 7.2.1-D20160217T041804

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a JIRA Software Board
# Click into the backlog
# Click 'View Summary of Assigned Work' next to the sprint name and the list of avatars.
# Click it again

h3. Expected Results

The summary of assigned work will load

h3. Actual Results

The summary of assigned work does not load, and hot keys are broken. The following javascript error comes up in the console:
{noformat}

batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&hasConnectAddons=tru...:8397 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'match' of undefined{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Reload the page
fields.summary: Clicking 'View Summary of Assigned Work' only loads once

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When _Parallel Sprint_ is enabled and there are at least two Sprints shown in a board, selecting one of them will also display issues from the other Sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Parallel Sprint 
# Have a board and two Sprints (A and B)
# Assign some issues in both Sprints and start them.
# Go to Active Sprint -> select one of the Sprint (ie. Sprint B)

h3. Actual Results

Issues from Sprint A are shown too in Active Sprint view.

h3. Expected Results

Only issues from Sprint B are shown in Active Sprint View.
fields.summary: Issues belong to different Sprint are shown when another Sprint is selected in Active Sprint view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Shortcut keys do not work when using a board references projects with mulitple workflows. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project have at least two non-simplified workflows associated with the project. 
# Reference project in board filter.
# Use shortcut keys i.e. G+I for issue view. 

h3. Expected Results
The shortcut keys would work. 
h3. Actual Results
The shortcut key does not work. There are no errors returned in the workflow or in the logs. 

h3. Notes
We have a vague workaround listed on [Some shortcut keys do not work in the issue detail view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=779159022]. Though having a user switch to simplified workflows just to get shortcut keys to work hardly seems like a workaround.
fields.summary: Shortcut keys do not work in Boards with non-simplified workflows intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you un-release a version\release in JIRA that has already triggered a Bamboo build and then attempt to re-release electing to trigger a new build in Bamboo, the release will fail indicating that JIRA can't contact Bamboo.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a release in JIRA
# Associate an issue with the release via the fixVersion field
# Commit changes to a repository being synchronized via DVCS including the issue key associated with the release in the commit message
# Create a build plan in Bamboo that uses the same repository
# Release and choose to a trigger a new build in Bamboo
# Unrelease the version\release from the JIRA Releases page via the Actions ellipses menu.
# Release the version again and choose to trigger a new Bamboo build

h3. Expected Results
A new Bamboo build is triggered.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA complains it can't contact Bamboo.
!Screen Shot 2016-09-16 at 12.31.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
No errors are written to either the JIRA or Bamboo application logs when the error is thrown.
fields.summary: Re-releaseing Fails to Trigger New Bamboo Build

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an existing board / project
# Near the top-left corner, click on "Create Board"
# Select the board type you want
# Select "Board from an existing Saved Filter" and hit "Next"

 !Screen Shot 2016-10-17 at 10.46.03 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

You're prompted to enter the JQL filter for the board

h3. Actual Results

The filter drop-down is locked
 

h3.Workaround

Create the board form the "Boards" menu

# Click on boards > View all boards
# Click on "Create Board".
fields.summary: Unable to create board from JQL filter.

fields.description:
When adding an issue to an epic (via the "Epic Link" custom field), the user needs edit permission for both the issue that's being added into the epic _and_ the epic itself. If they lack edit permission for the epic, JIRA Software will still allow selecting of the epic for the child issue but after clicking Save the Epic Link doesn't show on the child issue and there's no indication as to why this has occurred.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two projects A and B, and a user who has Edit Issues permission only for A but can otherwise view B.
# Create an epic in B and a regular issue in A.
# Edit the issue in A, select the Epic in B in the "Epic Link" field and click Save.

h3. Expected results
The user receives a message indicating that they don't have permission to add the issue to the Epic in B.

h3. Actual results
The save proceeds but the issue in A isn't added to the epic in B with no indication of why.
fields.summary: Adding an issue to an epic silently fails if the user doesn't have Edit Issues permission for both the epic and the child issue

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * 1000.383.2
 * Chrome: Version 53.0.2785.116 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Requires 2 users

User A:
 # Log into instance
 # Access a Agile Board
 # Backlog > Select issue > Add Comment
 # Leave a comment on issue > Select somewhere outside box

User B:
 # Log into instance
 # Access the same board
 # In Active Sprint > Move issue around (doesn't have to be same issue User A was commenting on)

User A:
 # After a few seconds try selecting Active Sprint (on left) or the Logo on top left
 # Page will refresh and the comment will be lost for User A

h3. Expected Results

For browser to notify you that the click you are about to make will result in lost changes.
 Warning like this:

!refresh-warn.png!
h3. Actual Results

Issue on Agile board refreshes after User B makes changes to an issue's workflow. All progress for User A's comment is lost.
h3. Workaround

None at this time.
fields.summary: Changes to the Agile Board Refreshes Pages for other users - Comments in progress are lost

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When entering data on the Epic Link custom field it does not autocomplete and needs to have the Epic issue ID filled out manually

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud
* JIRA Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue of the Epic type named "Bug Epic" Issue ID: BUG-1
# Create an issue of the Story type named "Bug Story" Issue ID: BUG-2
# Navigate to BUG-2, edit the "Epic Link field and type in "Bug Epic" note that it does not auto complete
# Instead of waiting for the autocomplete simply type in BUG-1 and hit the Submit button

h3. Expected Results
The epic link field will autocomplete when entering the name or ID of the epic

h3. Actual Results
No autocompletion occurs for the name or ID of the epic

h3.Workaround
Simply type in the Epic's issue ID in the Epic Link custom field and hit the Submit button
fields.summary: Epic Link field does not autocomplete name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It says "This board will *not* be a distraction-free zone.." when it should be "This board will *now* be a distraction-free zone.."

!image.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Labs, and enable Kanban backlog
# Now create a Kanban type project
# Choose the options to have the new backlog view
# Blank slate section is visible


h3. Expected Results
It should say "This board will *now* be a distraction-free zone for your team to focus on work-in-progress"


h3. Actual Results
Instead of the word now, the word not is shown.
fields.summary: Typo on JIRA Kanban Labs message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During JIRA Softwate on-boarding one can go through multiple steps that shows basic usage of JIRA. The problem is that front-end view is getting stuck on 8th step. Clicking "Next" button do not move to next dialog. It looks that everything works well on back-end side as if I click 4 times on "Next" I am able to finish this process.
h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create new user or login as user which hasn't gone through on-boarding yet.
 2. Go to secure/WelcomeToJIRASoftware.jspa
 3. Go through on-boarding process
h3. Expected results

One should be able to see all 12 steps of on-boarding process.
h3.  Actual results

View is getting stuck on 8th step.

!Step beign stucked.png|thumbnail!

End following error is thrown when "Next" is clicked

!Error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If one will click "Next" few times more on-boarding will be finished and user will be moved to this page
 !On-boarding finished.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment 
This bug is affecting cloud instances.
fields.summary: JIRA Software onboarding is getting stuck on 8th step.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the saved filter being used by the board is affected by: JRA-62386, then the board won't appear in the Project list at the project sidebar

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter under JRA-62386 conditions.
# Use it in a JIRA Agile board.
# Check the related projects sidebar being retrieved by the filter

h3. Expected Results
The project sidebar should have a link for this board.

h3. Actual Results
The project sidebar does not have a link for the board.

h3.Workaround
Same as described on: JRA-62386

Sometimes, however, manually editing the filter and changing the related projects from IDs to Project Keys can solve the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Boards not associating with projects if saved filter is affected by JRA-62386

fields.description:
If you Try to Launch Gliffy from Agile using the Action Drop down in the Details View Payne, you will trigger an error from the Gliffy app.
||Error | File failed to render. Please send a report to Gliffy. You can view the report before it is sent. Sadly, you may need to refresh your browser to continue working normally.||
With the options
- Send Error Report
- No Thanks

Clicking Send Error Report does not display the error report as the error states it will.

h3.Solution
Contact Gliffy Support and report the Issue at:
http://support.gliffy.com/anonymous_requests/new

h3.Workaround 1
- Click No Thanks or submit error report to bypass the error
- Shapes will not load at this point
- you will have minimal use of the Plugin
- after saving the page will display the error again but the diagram will be added to the ticket
- to exit you will have to close the page or edit the URL

h3.Workaround 2
- open issue directly
- select the more drop-down
- select add Gliffy diagram
- Do not open in new window (This can trigger the error as well)
- if opened in the same window the error is not triggered and the shapes will load.

h3.Possible Development Fix.
- have the javascript wizard open from Agile rather than open new window.
fields.summary: Adding Gliffy diagram from agile Error's

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever you try to scroll the backlog of a JIRA Agile project on an iPad you end up moving issues rather than scrolling the page

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.5.2
iPad iOS 9.3.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Agile project on an iPad
# Open project backlog
# Attempt to scroll down the page while pressing on an issue

h3. Expected Results
Page should scroll without moving issues

h3. Actual Results
Item attempts to be reordered in the backlog list

h3.Workaround
(If there is no workaround directly say so)
fields.summary: Unable to scroll backlog on iPad without moving issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When saving a sprint goal in the new 'Spring Goal' field, the value is lost after refreshing the page or navigating away from it.

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v1000.148.3
Cloud JIRA Agile v1000.0.11-D20160708T023659


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new sprint
# Click 'Edit Sprint'
# Add a 'Sprint Goal'
# Click 'Update'
# Refresh the page or navigate away and back to the 'Backlog' view


h3. Expected Results
The 'Sprint Goal' should remain visible after a refresh or navigating away from and back to the 'Backlog' view


h3. Actual Results
The 'Sprint Goal' is no longer visible when refreshing the page or navigating away and back to the 'Backlog' view

 
h3. Notes
When looking in the JIRA database you can see that the value has been writtin correctly:

{noformat}
jira=> select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "NAME" = 'Testing Sprint Goal Field';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE | END_DATE | ID |           NAME            | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED | START_DATE |         GOAL
--------+---------------+----------+----+---------------------------+---------------+----------+---------+------------+-----------------------
 f      |               |          | 73 | Testing Sprint Goal Field |             1 |          | f       |            | This is a sprint goal
(1 row)
{noformat}

Additional: 
- Setting the 'Spring Goal' field subsequent times, does not cause the value to display
- Updating the 'Sprint Goal' field does update the database


h3.Workaround
There is currently no work around
fields.summary: Sprint Goal value does not persist on refresh/reload or navigating away from Backlog view

fields.description: The filter of the agile board gadget does not filter correctly, even if use a quick filter or a filter created by the user. For instance: using *Only My Issues* filter, the gadget in the dashboard shows all issues.
fields.summary: Agile board gadget quick filter doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As of this moment, a number of JIRA Cloud instances have reported instances of smart commits reporting the wrong username within issue-level activity logs. Instead of associating the smart commit with the correct username, it is displayed as “$user_name” instead.

h3. Notes
* *Associations are still working as intended, since clicking on the $user_name link sends you to the correct Bitbucket user*

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.456.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Bitbucket, push a smart commit, associated with a JIRA issue tag
# On JIRA, browse to the issue associated with the commit
# Click on the Activity tab

h3. Expected Results
A proper username should be reflected within the activity entry

h3. Actual Results
$user_name is displayed instead
 
h3.Workaround
No current workaround known
fields.summary: Smart Commits from Bitbucket not displaying the correct username

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Selecting any _Quick Filter_ on JIRA Software Boards, navigate to 'Issue list' from the left panel, will lead the previously selected _Quick Filter_ to be forgotten.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a Kanban Project
# Navigate to the Kanban Board
# Select a quick filter 
#* !Selection_295.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the issue list
#* !Selection_296.png|thumbnail!  
# Go back to the Kanban Board

h3. Expected Result

Quick filter is remembered and selected.

h3. Actual Result

Quick filter is not selected.
!Selection_298.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Manually select/click the quick filter
fields.summary: Quick Filter is not remembered after navigating to 'Issue List'

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issues that have story points estimated do not seem to be burning down when they are closed out. The burndown chart is however burning up when you open a ticket within the sprint. The burndown chart will show points burning up but will not burn them down.


h3. Environment

Cloud / Server?


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new ticket within a project that has a current sprint
# Make sure there are story points on the issue
# Close the issue out
# Run the burndown chart report

h3. Expected Results

Issue should show story points burning down when running the burndown chart

h3. Actual Results

Points are added to the burndown chart
Points do not burn down
Where points are added shows an event of type 'burndown'
fields.summary: Issues burning up but not burning down during sprint when issues are closed out

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When starting a sprint with a combination of stories and tasks, a warning will appear with the following:
{quote}
Issue <issue number> does not have a value for the 'Estimate' field. Values entered after the start of the sprint will be treated as scope change.
{quote}
While it is only a warning and the sprint can still be started, this can cause confusion, as tasks other than stories in the sprint will not have story point estimates (or even an estimate field). The warning should only be looking for unestimated stories and the subtasks of those stories.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test sprint
# Add an estimated story to the sprint
# Add a task/issue to the sprint without an estimate (you will not have the option to add an estimate)

h3. Expected Results
Sprint should start as all necessary estimates are present.

h3. Actual Results
You will receive the warning mentioned above.
 
h3.Workaround
Ignore warning.
fields.summary: No Estimate Warning for Non-Story Items When Starting Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Using Time Estimation the estimate values are not displayed 

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-04-012
* JIRA Agile v7.1.11-D20160106T005545

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Board Configuration
# SET Estimation Statistic to {{Original Time Estimate}}
# Set Time Tracking to {{Remaining Estimate and Time Spent}} 

h3. Expected Results
Estimation is calculated

h3. Actual Results
No Estimation Calculated in
- Streetlight icons on backlog view
!Screen Shot 2016-01-11 at 5.48.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- Versions in backlog
!Screen Shot 2016-01-11 at 5.51.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- Workload By Assignee:
!Screen Shot 2016-01-11 at 6.11.22 PM.png|thumbnail!

Notes:
Time format is represented with a NULL value and needs to be re-associated

h3.Workaround
- Go to Time tracking settings:
-- G + G time tracking
or
-- https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin!default.jspa
- Deactivate
- Confirm that the following value is set to pretty
-- *Time format: pretty*
- Activate
fields.summary: Time Estimation failing to calculate

fields.description:
A team member created a quickfilter with an invalid JQL statement, and didn't notice the cross showing it was invalid, and added it anyway. After doing this, removing/deleting the quickfilter doesn't work in most cases. The invalid JQL statement was "labels = SRP-*" for example.

Clicking the 'remove' button on this quick filter came up with a confirmation dialog and the option to delete. After clicking delete it was still there.

Changing the query to a valid JQL statement did not work either. The query stayed the same after clicking 'Update.

Workaround:
I managed to delete it purely by accident, by changing the query to just a new line character, clicking update, then deleting. However it took me a while to figure that out. Even changing the query to something valid didn't seem to work.
fields.summary: Invalid JQL quickfilters are very hard to delete

fields.description:
I find it extremely difficult to discern which of the filters are selected in the Cumulative Flow Report.  

It's bad enough when it's first opened, but it's even harder to distinguish between when the mouse hovers over a filter, when a filter is clicked to unselect, etc.

I tested this on OS X with Chrome and Firefox.

In the attachment titles below: "enabled" means that the filter is in the enabled state (i.e. the button is pressed), "selected" means that the most recent thing the user has clicked is that button (either to enable or disable the filter).
fields.summary: Very difficult to identify selected filters in Cumulative Flow Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Error when accessing reports if the Board Estimation is configured as following:
 !Board Estimation in Story Points.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a board and configure the Board Estimation
# Select *Remaining Estimate and Time Spent* under Time Tracking

h3. Expected results
No error should be thrown when the accessing the reports

h3. Actual results
Error: 
{code}
Trying to combine JQL expressions without logical operator. The current JQL is '{project = "ATP"}'.
{code}

h3. Affected Version:
* JIRA version {{1000.550.0}}
* Agile version {{1000.163.0}}

h3. Notes
The bug also affects boards with _Original Time Estimate_ selected as _Estimation Statistics._

h3. Workaround (if board uses Story Points as estimation)
Select *None* under *Time Tracking* (Remaining Time Estimate can not be tracked for Story Points)
fields.summary: Reports unavailable if Remaining Time Estimate is selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Epic Report graph displays Totals on the right of the graph and the link to "view in issue navigator" links to a search where more issues are shown than the totals in the graph.

h3. Cause
The Report is generated using the statuses mapped to columns in the Board Columns configuration and the link to "view in issue navigator" doesn't filter by columns. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Un-map statuses from the board columns
# Add an issue to an Epic
# Transition the issue to an un-mapped status
# view the Epic Report graph totals and compare with the search results.

h3. Expected Results
The link to "view in issue navigator" shows the exact same issues used to render the graph and added to the totals.

h3. Actual Results
The totals in the graph are less than the results shown by the search.
Total Issues and Story Points are less in the Report than adding the search results.

h3. Notes
Normally all statuses are mapped to columns so a link to "Epic Link" = "EPIC-123" would suffice to list all issues on the Epic and that would match the graph totals, but it is not the case when not all statuses are mapped.
 
h3.Workaround
Map all statuses to board columns
fields.summary: Epic Report "view in issue navigator" links to incorrect search results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Drag and drop of issues on Kanban board is triggering a javascript error: Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sample project of Kanban type.
# Visit the Kanban board for the first time, select any issue to Expand the Issue Details View in right sidebar.
# Navigate away from the Kanban board and then return to the Kanban board by selecting it from the Board menu. The last viewed issue should still be active (selected), and Issue Details View should be expanded for this issue (Jira remembered this for us).
# Try to DRAG any OTHER issue on the board by click and HOLD of the left mouse button. It is important to take this step right after opening the Kanban board, and not to left-click any issue beforehand on this screen.

h3. Expected Results
The dragged issue should becomes selected in the Issue Detail view, and you can transition the issue by dragging it to another column.

h3. Actual Results
A Javascript error pops-up 
bq. "Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null" 
pops up, and the issue can't be moved.
 
h3. Notes/Workaround
# The error is triggered only when Issue Details View in right sidebar is already expanded when user visit the Board. If it's collapsed (hidden), the no error will be thrown.
# The error is triggered only when user tries to Drag issues that aren't shown in the Issue Details View, i.e. all issues except the currently selected one. If user tries to Drag currently selected issue, no error is thrown.
# The error is thrown only if no issue selection events took place on the Board since user opened it. If any issue where explicitly selected by the user and the contents of the Issue Details View where reloaded, then no error will be shown.
fields.summary: In cloud, Javascript errors in the console when dragging issues on Kanban board

fields.description:
I wanted to delete the bitbucket account automatically created by OnDemand because of the naming. I transfered the repositories to my private bitbucket account and then deleted the OnDemand account expecting that OnDemand will automatically remove the links from JIRA. But this didn't happen. The DCVS-connector still shows the deleted bitbucket account and the application links section still contains a link to it which I cannot remove.

Clicking "Refresh lists" for any bitbucket account in the DCVS-connector settings leads to an error page (see attachment). Now I'm stuck here with the dead links.
fields.summary: Deleting the OnDemand bitbucket-account does not remove the links from OnDemand JIRA

* When I hit link a repository i get this error:

I really want to get this functionality going for our Jira instance, but I am stumped on this.

James
